ca.ualberta.cs.c301f13t13.backend

Class ChapterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.c301f13t13.backend.ChapterManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StoringManager

    public class ChapterManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements StoringManager
    Role: Interacts with the database to store, update, and retrieve chapter objects. It implements the StoringManager interface and inherits from the Model class, meaning it can hold SHViews and notify them if they need to be updated. Design Pattern: Singleton
    Author:
    Stephanie Gil
    See Also:
    Chapter, StoringManager

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.Object object)
        Inserts a new chapter into the database.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface StoringManager
        Parameters:
        object - Object to be stored in the database. In this case, it will be a chapter object.

      • retrieve

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> retrieve(java.lang.Object criteria)
        Takes a chapter object that holds the desired search criteria (null values for any parameter that you don't want included in the search, for example, chapter text). It then retrieves a chapter or chapters from the database that matched the criteria and returns them in an ArrayList.
        Specified by:
        retrieve in interface StoringManager
        Parameters:
        criteria - Criteria for the object(s) to be retrieved from the database.
        Returns:
        chapters Contains the objects that matched the search criteria.

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.Object newObject)
        Updates a chapter's data in the database.
        Specified by:
        update in interface StoringManager
        Parameters:
        newObject - Holds the new data that will be used to update.

      • setSearchCriteria

        public java.lang.String setSearchCriteria(java.lang.Object object,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sArgs)
        Creates the selection string (the sql where clause) to be used in the database query. Also creates an array holding the items the selection arguments, since the selection string is a prepared statement. Eg. selection: WHERE CHAPTER_ID = ? selectionArg = "11244543"
        Specified by:
        setSearchCriteria in interface StoringManager
        Parameters:
        object - Holds the data needed to build the selection string and the selection arguments array.
        sArgs - Holds the arguments to be passed into the selection string.
        Returns:
        selection The selection string.
